questions.questionContent: Gross Primary Deficit can be calculated by which of the following equation?
questions.optionA: Net borrowings at home +Borrowing from RBI +Borrowing from abroad-Net Interest liabilities
questions.optionB: Net borrowings at home +Borrowing from RBI+Borrowing from abroad-Net Interest liabilities
questions.optionC: Total expenditure-(revenue receipts+Non debt creating capital receipts)
questions.optionD: Net borrowings at home +Borrowing from RBI-Borrowing from abroad-Net Interest liabilities

questions.questionContent: Aggregate demand for final goods in a three sector model consists of which of the following?
questions.optionA: ex ante consumption.ex ante investment only
questions.optionB: ex ante investment,expost consumption.government spending etc.
questions.optionC: ex ante consumption.expost investment.government spending etc.
questions.optionD: ex ante consumption.ex ante investment.government spending etc.

questions.questionContent:
Demonetisation was a new intiative taken by Government of India. Arrange following in proper sequence/chronology:

(A). Demonetisation was announced in November 2016
(B). To tackle the problem of of corruption, black money terrorism and circulation of fake currency
(C). New currency notes in the denomination of Rs 500 and Rs2,000 were launched
(D). Old currency notes of Rs.500 and Rs.1,000 were no longer legal tender

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

RBI publishes figures for alternative measures of money supply. They are defined as:
(A) $M1=CU+DD$
(B) $M2=M1$ + Savings deposits with Post office, savings banks
(C) $M4=M3$+ Total deposits with Post savings organisations (excluding National Savings Certificates)
(D) $M4=M3$+ Total deposits with Post savings organisations (including National Savings Certificates)

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
Which of the following is not the feature of Indifference Curve.
questions.optionA: Two indifference curves never intersect each other.
questions.optionB: Lower Indifference curve gives greater level of utility.
questions.optionC: Indifference curve slopes downwards from left to right.
questions.optionD: Higher Indifference curve gives greater level of utility.
